titleStmt.title: King County v. William Hughes and Micheal Broderick. Writ of Habeaus Corpus

bibl.title: King County v. William Hughes and Micheal Broderick. Writ of Habeaus Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington and County of Kitsah To any Constable and the Keeper of the jail of said County Where as at a Justice Court held at Port Gamble in said County Oct. 5. 1896 for the trail of Mike Sweeny and Finnegan, William Hughes was brought into said Court as witness and the magnitude of the trail being greater than the jurisdiction of said justice and one requiring the jurisdiction of the United States District Court to automatic the said William Hughes was bound but said District Court in the sum of $300 three hundred dollars and hide fault of said bail to stand committed with said justice was satisfied or otherwise discharged Therefor you the said constable are commanded in the cause of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said William Hughes to said Keeper and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said William Hughes into your custody in said jail and keep him there safely keep bail is procured to which he shall then be discharged by due Congress of law. Survey under my hand this 5th day of Oct. 1876 Geo. Dwelly Justice of Peace
